segments.text: I see the woman by the sink, oblivious to the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems so absorbed in polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe she hasn’t noticed the water pouring over the edge of the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is growing larger, and it’s just a matter of time before someone slips.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she ever looks around her when she's focused on chores.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And then there are those kids, up to no good, as usual.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on that wobbly stool makes my heart race a little.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s reaching into that cookie jar like it’s a treasure chest.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl next to him is waiting, her hand poised like a bird ready to take flight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What a scene—one of innocence mixed with impending disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I almost want to shout, 'Stop!' but what good would that do?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Everything looks so calm outside, yet inside, it feels like a ticking time bomb.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how easily this could all go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This moment is a snapshot of their carefree childhood, despite the risks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just hope they don't end up in a heap on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR
